messages.title: Annabel Goldie visits Drum Riding for the Disabled
messages.content: Scottish Conservative Leader, Annabel Goldie, visited Drum Riding for the Disabled in the constituency, expressing the importance of such facilities.

messages.title: Schools update
messages.content: Neil Hudson advocates better discipline, real aspiration and achievement for pupils.

messages.title: Conservative MSPs hit the campaign trail in Edinburgh South
messages.content: Conservative MSPs campaign to reduce Council Tax and promise to protect local services such as post offices.

messages.title: It's a two horse race!
messages.content: Only David Cameron's Conservatives can overtake Gordon Brown. The information suggests that local Lib Dem voters are switching to Conservatives to get rid of Labour.

messages.title: Conservatives favourites to win seat from Labour
messages.content: Quotes endorsing the Conservative candidate's chances to win Edinburgh South.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Increase pensions in line with earnings, maintain the freeze on Council Tax, and campaign against Labour's plans to scrap the Disability Living Allowance and the attendance allowance.
Improving schools by advocating for better discipline and aiming for real achievement and aspiration.
Reducing Council Tax and protection of local services such as post offices.

mentions.tacticalSituation: Local Lib Dem voters switching to the Conservatives to get rid of Labour.

issues.education: Advocates for better discipline, real aspiration and achievement for pupils in schools.
issues.environment: Conservatives support the development of renewable energies.
issues.socialWelfare: Commitment to safeguard and improve upon elderly benefits such as pensions, Disability Living Allowance, and Attendance Allowance.

quotes.text: Only David Cameron's Conservatives can overtake Gordon Brown.
Local Lib Dem voters switching to the Conservatives to get rid of Labour.

images.caption: Annabel Goldie with local residents at Drum Riding for the Disabled.
Neil Hudson with supporters holding a 'Vote for a win' banner.
Neil Hudson introduces David Cameron to University of Edinburgh's Principal, Professor Sir Timothy O'Shea.

leaflet.additionalNotes: The leaflet emphasizes the tactical situation in Edinburgh South, urging Lib Dem voters to switch to the Conservatives to remove Labour's hold on the seat.
